children.subject: Announcements have to get screened before being added, but send them to Nicole!
If a Cal student organization has a CS opportunity they would like added to the list of announcements, who should they send it to?

history.content:
Richard & Ruben Rosillo Grant Application

We are pleased to announce that the Richard & Ruben Rosillo Grant is now officially open. The Richard & Ruben Rosillo grants are awarded to low-income transfer students who have medical, dental, health, or unforeseen circumstance expenses.

Students must be Pell Grant or Dream Act Scholarship recipients as verified by the Financial Aid & Scholarships Office. Grants may be awarded based on verifiable unmet needs determined by the Financial Aid Office. Please read through the application carefully and entirely to ensure eligibility.

To access the application, visit http://transfers.berkeley.edu/rosillo-grant

Priority is given to students who have exhausted all of their subsidized loans. Students who submit grant requests and have remaining unused subsidized loan awards may only be eligible for 50% of the individual grant limits.

Applications are reviewed on a case by case basis.

Career Connections: Educational Technology (EdTech)

Tuesday March 20th. 6-8pm

Career Center Blue & Gold Room

Interested in jobs at the nexus of Tech and Public Service/Education? Come meet Cal alums at leading Educational Technology companies including Khan Academy, GoalBook, Springboard, Magoosh, and more who are shaping the face of educational technology in the Bay Area and beyond! This is a massively growing industry with many opportunities in roles such as:

Software Engineering

Business and Partnership Development
Product Management  

Data Science
& More!

 

This is a great opportunity to ask questions, gain knowledge from industry insiders, and create meaningful connections that could lead to a future internship or job!

Google Summer of Code

See flyer for more information.

Save your semester workshops

See flyer for more information.

Haas Scholars program

For those interested in getting involved in research, right now at this time of the year we are transitioning into the “getting ready to dive into summer research” phase (for sophomores and juniors), and the “getting ready to share my research with the world” phase (for those now completing research).  Check out the opportunities to get started on your human subjects protocol -- workshops this Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. Also, there are a few more opportunities to fund your summer research with March, April, and May deadlines, and the calls for papers for conferences are beginning to pop up. As always, this is also a great time to plan your approach for next year.   Full details are here.  

UC Berkeley L&S CS at SunCode Hackathon

Powerhouse is hosting our annual SunCode Hackathon on April 13-14 in Oakland at the Citizen Engagement Laboratory, and we'd love for L&S CS students to participate.

 

SunCode brings together over 150 software developers, designers, and industry professionals to build demos in 24 hours with a chance to win 10K in cash prizes. Participants don’t need to know anything about clean energy, just have a willingness to learn and hack away at interesting problems.

 

Our industry partners this year are: Tesla, Schneider Electric, Vestas, Sunrun, and Nissan Renault. Powerhouse provides plenty of beer, food, good company, and networking opportunities throughout the weekend.

 

Folks can come as individuals or form teams. Tickets can be bought here. Details are on Devpost here.

 

UC Berkeley L&S CS students can use the code POWERON10 for 10% off.

E3S Work-study

The Center for Energy Efficient Electronics Science (E3S) is seeking a student assistant to support the Center's administrative office. Tasks include sorting and filing materials; data entry, turning Excel spreadsheets into readable tables; manipulating spreadsheet data; conducting web searches; creating and posting flyers; preparing travel and entertainment reimbursement requests; placing miscellaneous supplies orders; and other office duties as their arise; assisting with outreach and event/meeting planning, including scheduling remote access, distributing announcements, set-up and breakdown, creating scientific demonstrations; compile and edit annual report; creating, updating mailing lists and data files, supporting mass mailing campaigns, and assembling meeting materials.

 

E3S is a fun and flexible environment!

Summer Forestry Field Program

Forestry Field Camp application due for Summer 2018!  

 

Forestry Field Camp at the University of California, Berkeley is an eight-week intensive program that provides an introduction to the scientific and professional dimensions of forest and wildland resource management.   It consists of four courses: ESPM 105A, B, C, and D which provide students with 11 semester credits from the University of California, Berkeley. Students study the biota, soils, and geology in the beautiful mountains of the Plumas National Forest.

 

For more information about the experience: https://forestrycamp.berkeley.edu/

 

Summer Session C: June 18-Aug. 10

(though students arrive Sunday, June 17th at camp)

Apply at https://forestrycamp.berkeley.edu/apply-2/

Deadline for application extended: March 25, 2018

 

If you have any questions, please contact me at gsadil@berkeley.edu. See flyer here.
